A Window on the Past ...  would finish his tenure as South Portland's city manager in 1971 when he was hired as the general manager of the new Maine Mall. He would shepherd the growth of the mall over many more years. Another interesting highlight of Allen's life is his love and support for the game of baseball. In 1965, he helped secure Ametek as the sponsor of South Portland's baseball team in the Twilight League. When Ametek stepped away as sponsor four years later, Allen stepped up and became the general manager of the team, the South Portland Merchants, helping to raise funds to keep the team active in the Twilight League.
